summary: George Papadopoulos was born August 19, 1987 at Swedish Covenant Hospital[1] in Chicago, Illinois,[7] to Greek immigrants[1][8] originally from Thessaloniki.[9] His father, Antonis, was heavily involved in the local politics of the Greek-American community[9] and the former president of the Pan-Macedonian Union of the United States.[9] His mother, Kate (Kiki), was born in Greece and listed her hometown on her son's birth certificate as Worcester, Massachusetts.[2] For years he lived at a large house on the corner of a tree-lined street[2] in Lincolnwood, Illinois[1] and graduated from Niles West High School in Skokie, Illinois, in 2005. He graduated with a bachelor's of arts degree in political science from DePaul University in 2009.[2][10] He earned an MSc degree in Security Studies in 2010 at University College London.[2][11] He speaks Arabic, English, French and Greek.[7]
question: Where was Georgios Papadopoulos born?
label: Swedish Covenant Hospital[1] in Chicago, Illinois
